function_call.name: classify_risks_framework
function_call.arguments: {"sorted_risks":[{"name":"Lack of understanding of disease identification and treatment","category":"Communication Network","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Contagious diseases spreading in early health facility designs","category":"Buildings/Blocks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Unsanitary, dim, and poorly aerated building","category":"Buildings/Blocks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Regularly situated face-to-face hospital wards with contagious people","category":"Buildings/Blocks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate sterilization of medical devices and lack of patient separation","category":"Buildings/Blocks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Inadequate hospital infrastructure for dealing with airborne infections","category":"Buildings/Blocks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Historical pandemic experiences inform architectural design","category":"Buildings/Blocks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Insufficient policies and infrastructure for addressing airborne infections","category":"Buildings/Blocks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Inadequate ventilation in indoor environments","category":"Dwelling","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of airborne infection control policies in hospital architecture design","category":"Buildings/Blocks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Presence of potentially dangerous contaminants in indoor spaces","category":"Dwelling","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Droplet transmission of viruses through sneezing and coughing in confined spaces.","category":"Air","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Airborne transport of droplets leading to long-distance transmission of viruses.","category":"Air","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Waterborne transmission of infections through contaminated water sources.","category":"Water","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Waterborne transmission of contagious infections due to microbial contamination of water sources","category":"Water","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Longevity of pathogens on surfaces and in the environment leading to indirect transmission of infections","category":"Soil","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Transmission of respiratory infections through contact with surfaces and indoor environments","category":"Soil","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Accumulation of human-related microbes and pathogens in indoor environments","category":"Dwelling","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Contamination of fomites and surfaces with sars-cov-2 particles","category":"Dwelling","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Potential humans.","category":"Dwelling","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Sars-cov-2 particles can remain and live on fomites for a period varying from a few hours to five days, depending on the materials.","category":"Dwelling","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Survival of covid-19 particles on different materials and in different environments.","category":"Dwelling","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Discovery of sars-cov-2 virus rna in hospital exterior environments and clinical
